intro: Isertia humboldtiana, commonly known as the Humboldt's isertia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal dunes and rocky shores. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
